title: Enhancing Efficiency and Collaboration in Research-Driven Microscopy Laboratory
content: The field of microscopy has witnessed rapid advancements in technology and methodology, necessitating the presence of centralized research facilities equipped with state-of-the art instrumentation and expert personnel. Since its establishment in 2005, the Microscopy Core Laboratory at New York University (NYU) Grossman School of Medicine has been at the forefront of providing cutting-edge imaging technologies to the research community. Initially focused on electron microscopy (EM), the Core has expanded its services over the past 18 years to include optical microscopy, and high-resolution three-dimensional imaging technologies.
